Python, Playwright, BDD, Gherkin, Robot framework

SRC - source code

The source code is located in the src directory and is executed by tests using the fixtures login, logout, and send_the_email. The code in the src directory contains the main logic that powers Playwright and the test cases.

Get password

The get_password.py file contains the function get_password_from_env that reads the password from the config.env file and serves also for the Robot framework.

src.get_password.get_password_from_env() → str

Retrieves the ‘PASSWORD’ environment variable from the ‘config.env’ file.

Returns:

The string associated with the ‘PASSWORD’ key in the environment variables.

Login

The loginn.py file contains the Login class that is responsible for logging into an email account using provided credentials.

class src.login.Login(page: Page)

Class for logging into an email account using provided credentials.

execute_login(credentials: dict) → None

Log into the email account using provided credentials.

Parameters:

credentials – A dictionary containing ‘email’ and ‘password’. ‘email’: The email address to log in. ‘password’: The password for the email account.

Returns:

None

Logout

The logout.py file contains the Logout class that is responsible for logging out of a Google account.

class src.logout.Logout(page: Page)

Class for logging out of a Google account.

execute_logout(credentials: dict) → None

Execute the logout process for the provided Google account.

Parameters:

credentials – A dictionary containing ‘account_name’ and ‘email’. ‘account_name’: The name associated with the Google account. ‘email’: The email address of the Google account.

Send the email

SendTheEmail class for sending an email.

class src.send_the_email.SendTheEmail(page: Page)

Class for sending an email using provided credentials.

add_attachment() → None

Adds an attachment to the email.

Returns:

None

iframe_name_io() → None

Extracts the id and the ‘name’ attribute of the open iframe with the expected state ‘Contacts’.

Returns:

None

prepare_email(credentials: dict) → None

Prepares an email by navigating through the iframe and filling out the email details.

Parameters:

credentials – A dictionary containing ‘name_from_contacts’ and ‘email_address_from_contacts’. ‘name_from_contacts’: The name associated with the contact. ‘email_address_from_contacts’: The email address associated with the contact.

Returns:

None

prepare_email_for_attachement() → None

Prepares an email for sending with an attachment.

Returns:

None

send_email() → None

Sends the email.

Returns:

None
